name: President Palace Hotel

reviews.text: This is a great hotel with the perfect location for shopping and clubbing. I recomend that you take the room with the club benefits, it's really worth it. We had free cocktails daily at certain times of the day. This hotel has great service, you will be treated like kings and queens.
reviews.title: Precident Palace Hotel December 2011

reviews.text: So here's the dilemma: with a little effort, you can find plenty of great US$100 a night hotel rooms in Bangkok. So do you stay in a 'true' 5 star where the rooms may be more luxurious, but you're paying extra for almost everything...or do you stay here, on a 'club' floor, where the room may be slightly more simple (although completely clean and comfortable) and you may have occasional annoyances like power outages...but you'll get a whole range of nice perks?
reviews.title: Solid four star -- take my advice and spring for a 'club room'

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To me, there's no contest...and that's why the President Palace has become one of my favorite hotels anywhere. From evening cocktails (unlimited) with nice hors d'ouevres...little plates of laab...so yummy...I ate three...to decent breakfast...to 2 laundry items a day (a godsend especially when it's really hot out...nothing like putting on a freshly laundered shirt.) And even when I've stayed only for one night, they've honored this perk and worked hard to get my laundry back before check-out time! A nice segue into saying the staff (at least on the club floor -- if you have a reservation here just bypass the lobby and go right up) could not be more friendly and helpful. (Their odd system of having you sign for even complimentary beverages so they have a record would be annoying if they weren't so nice about it...it just seems funny and quaint...I know I sound elitist...but this is a bit of what's holding this hotel back from true super-stardom, I think.)
reviews.title: First choice when in Bangkok

reviews.text: There's also the location: within walking distance of the Nana Skytrain and Asok subway (although a bit further than it looks on the map) and not a bad walk from all the area entertainment centers both high-and-low-end...and this being Bangkok, sometimes they're right across the street from each other!
reviews.title: My First Pick When In BKK

reviews.text: This was my second time with the President Palace and I certainly wasn't disappointed. I love this place because it's in one of the best soi's in Sukhumvit and great value. We again had the deluxe club room, and couldn't believe when we were given the exact same room as we had in February this year LOL. The service was wonderful, pool was great, but if I had to be critical, it would be the breakfast in the club lounge. It was always the same everyday, and not much of a choice, but nevertheless, still OK. Our 9 night stay was fantastic, and I'm already looking forward to going back very soon. One thing I did miss this time in Soi 11 was the sticky rice and mango vendors. I was told it was out of season. Thank you PP for a wonderful stay - again. We will be back very soon.
reviews.title: Good location, Big rooms & friendly well informed staff

reviews.text: Great room, great hotel, great service, near the BTS, could go on and on about the pluses. However, at night, the area around the hotel brings out a very nefarious clientele (lets just leave it at that). Staff was wonderful, rooms were clean. The Man United bar was very cool.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel and service, however

reviews.text: Comfortable rooms, effective but impersonal service, good location and value
reviews.title: Good hotel and service

reviews.text: i travel several times a year to BKK and stayed here in july 2010. i was at the club level and found the hotel great. the location is great as there are many clubs and resturants on sukhumvit soi 11. the manchester united on the ground floor is great for football fans. the managers Complimentary pre-dinner Cocktails in the afternoon is great. the service was great and staff friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: first stay july 2011

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've travelled through Thailand as a backpacker, flashpacker and tourist in my time and have made this hotel my base in Thailand on my last 2 trips as a tourist without a low budget, but without wanting to slurge.
reviews.title: Good Location, Good Value. Top Hotel

reviews.text: Part of the larger Compass Group chain a room here should cost from £50 for B and B to £70 for a 'club' room.
reviews.title: Not for families

reviews.text: Fourth stay at this 4 star hotel. staff are extremely heklpful , especially the club floor staff.We stayed during the floods and the hotel went out of their way to make our stay pleasant. free mini bar and drinks by the pool is a huge bonus.
reviews.title: Friendly service in a good location

reviews.text: Many other bars and places to eat near the hotel and its a short walk to the Nana Bts.I will stay here again In April.
reviews.title: Good central location, good large rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Went for business trip. Conveniently connected to efficient BRT transport.
reviews.title: Go for it!

reviews.text: We stayed in club floor room for 3 nights in September. Club floor isn't much more expensive than standard. I found it to be equal in comfort and value to Sheraton and Hilton.
reviews.title: Great experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-in at club lounge was smooth and fast. Only minor complain was that I had to call for our luggage twice but eventually they appeared.
reviews.title: A little disappointed

reviews.text: This hotel is located centrally to many attractions and is home to several great restaraunts and a dedicated team of service personel. The facilities are decent including the pool and other site facilities but the overal experience does not make the grade of other hotels in the same group such as the president solitair just up the road.
reviews.title: A hotel that could be better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In addition, the traveler should be aware of charges/penalties for early check out on thier reservation as after 3 days of a 5 day reservation we chose to move to a nicer facility but were charged a one day penalty even when we were told that would not be the case by the desk staff......
reviews.title: Book the Club Room, you won't regret it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Some facilities were non-functional in the room but overall met the grade
reviews.title: Excellent hotel!

reviews.text: A great 4 star choice in Bangkok - while it wasn't 5 star luxury, it was definitely comfortable, stylish and suberbly located. We booked the club room and hadn't really realised all the benefits that came with the package we got - free breakast in the club lounge (not a large selection but adequate with eggs cooked to order), free cocktails by the pool for half the day, at least 6 beverages free in our mini bar every day including beer and voda mixer and finally free cocktails and pre dinner snacks (a decent selection) in the evenings. We had been travelling for awhile and found this was the perfect place to just stop and unwind despite the fact we were in the heart of crazy Bangkok. We found we barely had to leave the hotel. To sum the hotel up:
reviews.title: Excellent value

reviews.text: - huge rooms, great city skyline views
reviews.title: Loved it

description: Located on the hip Sukhumvit Soi 11, President Palace is perfectly positioned with Nana BTS skytrain station, shopping, dining and entertainment outlets within walking distance. It features 236 spacious rooms and for a little more privacy Club Floors and a Club Lounge. Facilities and services include a fitness centre, pool and pool bar, Business Centre services, a restaurant, function room and more. Present your keycard for exclusive discounts and/or free entrance to select restaurants, bars and hospitals.
